data.entry: Prove her skill without the use of magic
data.name: Goals

characters.entry: A mysterious woman with extremely powerful Black magic, Alamania claims to be the embodiment of the Black Goddess.
characters.name: Alamania

characters.entry:
A wealthy trader who found his riches in delivering spices, fabrics, precious stones, and other goods between Latormeio and Polaris.

A slave trader who sold Tanai in to lord Evergreen.

A dumb doo doo head, a complete loser, his mom once told him "I thought I could fuck anyone in the world but then I saw your face."
characters.name: Shoreman Dumol
characters.title: The stupid idiot

characters.entry:
Older brother of Kota/Tomihiru, a Blue Wizard.

Hideo grew up in Umigate with his family, was a member of the Yellowhorn Cult, foiled Tomihiru's first attempt to contact law enforcement - leading to the death of at least 5 members of the city guards.

Killed himself when the city guard raided the cult's hideout, to avoid being captured.
characters.name: Hideo Nakamura

characters.entry:
Older brother of Kota/Tomihiru.

Grew up in Umigate and a member of the Yellowhorn Cult. Was taken by the guards during the raid.
characters.name: Shinsuke Nakamura

characters.entry: [character:288353]'s childhood friend. A Black Wizard who serves as a Priest in [location:301247], Araki is studying the history of the Stones and plotting the paths they took throughout history.
characters.name: Araki

characters.entry:
Born in GreenHill town, one of the poorest neighbourhoods in Polaris, he given as an infant to the city's Purple temple. He never knew his father, but his mother, Larysa, visited the temple every week and enjoyed the hospitality of the priests. She suddenly stopped visiting when he was 8, and was found dead almost a month later washed up in the river.

When he was 11, a trader told him that he would take him to Latormeio to be his ward and pupil, though unbeknownst to him he would actually be sold into slavery.
characters.name: Tanai

characters.entry:
A priest from [character:319362]. Kanshi wanted to meet [character:6181] and learn magic from her, so the two went to [location:316393].

On the road they encountered Kota, Besh, and Ellara, and they decided to walk together. That night, Kanshi gravely injured Geren and tried to steal the Green Stone from Ellara, but was stopped.
characters.name: Gerensil

characters.entry: Grand daughter of Axilya, left her grandmother behind and moved to Gessine around two years ago.
characters.name: Zhaya Lorafir

items.entry:
A rare plant found exclusively in the forests near Gessine, the roots and stem of this plant can be made into a bittersweet candy, and its leaves have many medical uses.

The seeds of this plant have a bright red and black colour, and they contain a powerful poison. Injesting a single seed can kill a person within hours or days, and prolonged external contact leads to rashes and hemorrhage. For unknon reasons, the poison within the seeds is even deadlier to Wizards: external contact often causes burns, and injestion or injection cause excruciating pain and can kill a Wizard in mere minutes.
items.name: Lightsbane (Wild Liqourice)

journals.entry:
After meeting and getting drunk at the [character:288351], and [character:288353], went with [character:288355] for a tour around the city. While pasing through [character:6181] and [character:288343], who were both giving speeches in front of a large crowd.

Alamania's speech was momentarily interrupted by a crossbow bolt that hit her in the stomach. She pulled it out while using her magic to heal the wound, and as she was resuming her speech, a second bolt flew her way. Kota deflected the second bolt before it connected, and Alamania was escorted out of the plaza by her guard, [character:288988].

As the crowd erupted into a violent mass, the gang decided to go after whoever shot the goddess. They narrowed it down to one building on the west of the plaza, so Elara and Kota flew up to the ceiling while Besh and Pasi went from the ground.

As they reached the 3rd floor, they encountered a rather suspicious-looking man, who seemed to dodge their questions, and was in a hurry to get out. After they let the man go, Elara snuck into his apartment to see if she could find any evidence, and she found a crossbow in a chest near a window overlooking the plaza. Meanwhile, Besh and Pasi guarded the appartment, and Besh noticed the other tenant on the third floor was an Orange Wizard. At the same time, Kota flew down the stairs to continue the search, but was held back by a couple members of the city guard who wanted to question him.

When the others finished their business on the third floor, they joined Kota at the bottom, and told the guards that they suspected the man on the third floor.

Afterwards, they went to look for Alamania, and found her in a small street behind the [location:288998], along with Ravani and a girl. They introduced themselves, and Alamania said that she's glad to see more people loyal to her cause, and that they would surely meet again.
journals.name: 01 - Marketplace Exposition

journals.entry:
After [character:288355], [character:288353], and [character:288351] decided to try to find the culprit again. They returned to the building that they previously searched. Before entering, they noticed bootprints on the back staircase. 

Besh and Elara pretended to be undercover guards, and went to ask the landlord for details about the man they encountered. They learned that his name is Shoreman Dumol, that he is a traveling merchant, and that he is leaving for Latormeio soon. Meanwhile, Kota and Pasi went upstairs to see if they could find more incriminating evidence, but had to back off when they found a guard questioning the other tenant on the third floor.

The gang decided to follow the tracks they found earlier, which led them to a small warehouse, where they saw Shoreman overseeing people loading crates onto horse carts. In the werhouse were sixteen other people: four mercenary guards, five cartdrivers, and seven others, three of whom were children. They waited until the following morning, when the Shoreman and his men left on the Gold Road, headed for Latormeio.

Our heroes followed Shoreman's caravan until they made camp for the night, when they decided they ould attempt to kidnap Shoreman. Kota and Pasi came up to the camp, and tried to distract them with a circus performance, and for one of their tricks they asked Shoreman to leave the camp with Pasi. As they past some trees, Elara and Besh swiftly tied and gagged him. Kota joined the others, and as they investigated the trader, they realized that he was innocent, and that it was someone else who had shot Alamania. They sneakily returned him to the camp, and headed back to the city.

The next day, they tried to find out more information about Alamania and [character:288343]. They found out that he was from a poor family of fishermen and that he used to frequent The Salted Shrimp, but then he came across a large sum of money, moved to a richer part of the city, and stopped going there. Later, at The Dancing Dragon, they talked to Sor Carres, a member of the City Council who is a known supporter of Elyas. After a brief talk and a large bribe from Shoreman's stolen wallet, Carres agreed to arrange them a meeting with Rynaio.
journals.name: 02 - Slavery, Smuggling, Suspicion

journals.entry:
[character:6181] without him. Her adopted child is a red wizard, a freed slave and a great cook. We find out that she isn't quite The Black Goddess, but has a piece of Black Goddess soul, high quality best price today. We also fond out that no one attempted to assasinate her, she asked someone loyal to her to injure her in order to gain power. When walking out of her house we find his dead body. He's been assasinated with the help of poison.

And not just any poison. Lightsbane.

We catch the killer and take him to Alamania. He's been hired by Joleniel, a council memeber who hates Alamania.

We put Pasi in the black temple (for healing, because we're worried over the poison). Later we go meet Elyas, who knows we're all buddy-buddy with his rival, and says there was barely any hate towards wizards in Polaris before Alamania came to stir in their politics, and that he only wants to make things the way they used to be. He has a rally outside the council building during Alamania's speech to the coucil, and we chose to watch Alamania's speech. She used the assasination of her bodyguard as a political trick, which is kindof what goes around comes back around to Joleniel.

The coucil are very much considering giving her a chance to lead a commity and research the city's wizard's condition. After the speech we saw a wizard getting lynched by the angry mob at the gates of the council, and Alamania declared that since she cannot change the city's views with words, she must resort to harsher methods.
journals.name: 03 - Revelations and Revolutions

journals.entry:
החבורה התחילה אצל אלאמניה, ששלחה אותנו להביא "משהו" ממערה שהופיעה בחיזיון שלה מהאלה השחורה. בש השתמש בקסם שלו על מנת לגלות את מיקום המערה. אלאמניה הודיעה שתחכה להם בתל-חנית.
וכך הם יצאו למסע של שבוע שלם לראות במה מדובר. בלילה השני תקפו זאבים בזמן המשמרת של קוטה – אשר מעד בדרך להרביץ לזאב עם מוט. הזאב המדובר הפך לכדור טניס במשחק עם טמפרטורות קיצוניות בין אלארה ובש. זאב אחר ניסה לנחות על קוטה, הועף לאוויר, נבעט, ומאוחר יותר הגולגולת שלו נמחצה כתוצאה מהנחיתה של קוטה.
החבורה אכלה בשר זאב בימים הקרובים, שהוכן על ידי אלארה. הוא היה טעים למדי.
כאשר הגיעו החברים אל המערה, הם ניסו להשתמש בבשר זאב על מנת למשוך החוצה את האריה שנמצא שם, אשר הופיעה בחיזיון של אלאמניה. מסתבר שמדובר בחבורה של פומות ידידותיות ובעלות מודעות אשר נתנו לחבורה את האבן הירוקה. אלארה לובשת אותה כמחרוזת מסביב לצוואר.
בדרך חזרה פגשה החבורה זוג מטיילים, גרנסיל וקנשאנור (משמעות בשפה העתיקה = לדקור אלים) שני כוהנים מכפר נהר-תפוח אשר באו לפגוש את אלאמניה. קנשי, הצעיר מביניהם, היה קוסם שחור חלש. הוא קיווה ללמוד קסם מאלאמניה.
בלילה לכל אחד מהחברים היה סיוט אשר התקשר לעבר שלהם, ובסופו מישהו ניסה להזהיר אותם בדרך כלשהי משדים.
השלישייה הקסומה התעוררה עם שמץ של קסם ירוק ומעשה גניבה – קנשי ברח עם האבן הירוקה.
הוא הצליח להשתמש בקסם חזק על מנת לבטל את האשליה שבש ניסה להטיל עליו, ובאופן מוזר מאוד לא היה לו שמץ של הילה קסומה. אלארה הצליחה לפוצץ את קנשי עם כדור אש, מה שהפך אותו לאבק מהר מאוד, והחולצה והשרשרת עם האבן הירוקה שופדו על ידי סכין שקוטה זרק.
בזמן שהחזירו את האבן הירוקה, בש גילה שגרן נדקר על ידי קנשי. מסתבר שגרן היה כמו אב לקנשי, והוא לא כל כך מעריך את התודה שהוא קיבל.
ההרפתקנים נאלצו לסור מתוכניתם המקורית לבקר את פסי, שעדיין יושב חולה במקדש שחור בפולאריס, ויכול להיות שהוא בסכנה ממלחמת אזרחים, על מנת להביא את גרן אל המושב הקרוב יותר, תל-חנית, שם קיבל טיפול רפואי.
לאחר שיחה עם אלאמניה התברר שמה שגנב את האבן הירוקה היה שד (לא ברור איך קנשי הפך לשד) ושהאלה הירוקה העירה את השלושה במטרה להגן על האבן.
נראה שהפומה פאלס נכנסו למשהו גדול יותר משהם חשבו.
journals.name: 04 - Parties with Pumas

journals.entry:
החבורה מבלה לילה בתל חנית, אבל שנתו של בש רדופה. אם רודפים אותה שדים או רוחות, זה לא ברור- בעיקר כי הפעם שניהם אחד. 

בש חש את האש בגבו, חוצה את אשליית העץ, בורח עם האבן, דוקר את גרנסיל, ונם את התנומה האחרונה שיתעורר ממנה, הכל דרך עיניו של קנשי. קנשי מספר לו את סיפור חייו- איך הוא תמיד היה קצת אחר, ידע שהוא לא בן אדם, הרג בני אדם שלמדו את סודו ואיימו לספר. אבל בעוד הוא למד להסתיר את טבעו האמיתי, הוא גם למד לאהוב. הוא לא רצה להרוג את גרנסיל, אבל הוא חש שלקחת את האבן זה "ייעודו" ו"המעשה הנכון". כעת, כשהוא לעולם לא יגשים את ייעודו, הוא בלבד מבקש שיזכרו אותו.

ובש, גם בעודו מעקם את האף על בחור שהיה הורג את הנזיר שגידל אותו, יזכור. אך האם הוא יספר לחבריו החדשים, עכשיו כשהוא חושד שהם שדים בעצמם?
journals.name: Discussion with a Demon

journals.entry:
After speaking to the Green Goddess in a dream, [character:288355|Ellara] revealed to [character:288353|Kota] and [character:288347|Besh] that the Green Stone is back, and that she is now the bearer of the Stone. The Puma Pals went back to the Black Temple in Polaris to check on [character:288351|Pasi] and were relieved to find him well. Kota got a message that sent the gang to the Blue Temple. 

Upon arriving at the Temple they met Araki, a Black wizard, Blue priest and Kota’s childhood friend, who told them about a demon attack which resulted in the death of two Purple priests. 

The demon, held in the dungeon underneath the Purple Temple, turned out to be a young girl. The girl almost immediately recognized the Puma Pals, and was confused to learn that Kota wasn’t the “yellow key”. While the trio talked to the demon girl Besh tried to read her mind, which resulted in flashing visions of a child waiting on a hill for a father who doesn’t return, one’s own hands burning, being electrocuted, and another child freezing at a city plaza. The Pals and Araki left the room and debated whether or not to kill the demon girl, not quite reaching a conclusion before returning to the dungeon, trying to talk to the girl again, which ended with Kota killing her with a throwing knife. 

Later that day the Pals and Araki were celebrating their shared birthdays, and planning a heist to get the White Stone from [location:6167|Haeven] (going by rumours alone), when [character:288997|Nelly] arrived, claiming to have followed her intuition and feeling like she should join the Pals on their quest. 

And so it seems that more allies will be joining our heroes on their journey...
journals.name: 05 - Demons of the Past

journals.entry:
After spending [event:288328] partying in [location:5988], [organisation:403714] left for [location:6167] to try and find the White Stone. On the second day of the journey they encountered a small band of bandits led by a man who called himself "Lord Heslin" and his sister, an Orange Wizard named Gremia. After a short skirmish the Puma Pals bested the bandits and questioned Germia. She explained that they lived peacefully (-ish) in [location:316393] up until to weeks prior, when someone on the [organisation:6180] decided to send a squad of the city guard to evict them. The guards slaughtered the bandits, and only four of them managed to escape. [character:288997] mentioned that there were no guards in the town when they had arrived, which seemed strange to the others.

A few days later the Puma Pals reached the city. They decided to split up: [character:288353] and [character:300697] would go to the Blue Temple to search for clues about the locations of any of the Stones, while [character:288347], [character:288355], and [character:288997] would go to the White Temple to look for the White Stone.

In the White Temple, Ellara snooped around the First Priest's study and found nothing out of the ordinary, except a small gap in the wall that stretched from the floor to the ceiling, was about a centimeter wide, and seemed to go all the way through it. She snuck out when just before the Priest arrived, and asked to speak with him about a study that she's doing. She asked him about the White Stone which he knew nothing about, stating that everyone always says it's in the temple, but he never saw it himself, and neither did his predecessor nor his predecessor's predecessor. When asked about the crack in the wall he explained that a couple of weeks ago he accidentally pushed the desk onto the wall and that gap formed, and he always forgets to call someone to have it fixed.

In the Blue Temple, Kota and Araki find manuscripts and letters mentioning the White Stone being used by a White Priest around 800 years ago, but can't seem to find any source more recent than that. They do however find a few letters from a couple of years ago between a Lord Mikkel in Lattormeio and the First Priest in Haeven's Black Temple, mentioning the Yellow and Orange Stones. They decide to pick up the other Puma Pals and go to investigate the Black Temple.

In the Black Temple they head straight for the First Priest's study and Kota barges in. [character:403753] is not impressed and tells them to return later, but concedes to let them in after some insistence. She admits that a couple of years ago she was contacted by a trader from [location:6175] who claimed to have found the Yellow and Orange Stones, but after meeting with him and a Yellow Priest from [location:6179] called [character:291114] she concluded that the Stones were fake and ceased communications with them. 

Kota excused himself from the room, and after the others followed and asked what happened he revealed that he knew Okada.
journals.name: 06 - Temple Trouble

journals.entry:
As [character:288347] falls asleep he sees his mother in the same white void where he saw [character:319362] the other night.

She greets him, and while it's in her voice, he can feel that it isn't her. She tells him that he and his friends have already killed two of her envoys.

She changes to Jacob. He's not mad, saying that while it's not ideal, it's a price that he's willing to pay.

He changes to Ellara. She knows Besh will do the right thing in the end, even if he doesn't want to.

She changes to Kanshi. He offers him a gift. He asks him if he would like to learn how he cut through his illusion magic.

He changes to Alamania. She says that she doesn't trust the mission falling into the hands of the gods, since while she believes they truly want the best for humanity, what she's bringing might be too much for them.

She changes to Araki. He knows that Besh will understand what he must do when the time is right, because he knows what really matters.

He tells him that [character:362745] (the demon they killed) wants to speak with him. 

He changes into her. She looks pretty much the same as when he last saw her, dressed in rags, barefoot and with dirty and mangled hair. She appears confused and distressed, doesn't understand where she is or what happened. She pulls away from Besh when she sees him. She asks what he did to her.

She asks from him to get revenge on her father for abandoning her, and tells him that she probably wasn't the first. She had two brothers and a mother who she never met. She doesn't know much about them, but she does know that her mother came from far away and feared her own magic. She was a Purple Wizard, and became enchanted by her father's magic. Her older brother is much older than her, and he was born like her mother, so her father hid him away when he was born. Her twin brother was also born like her mother, while she herself was more similar to her father. He left her mother and twin brother with nothing, while he took her in with him.

She's pretty sure her mother died a couple of years ago, but has no idea what happened to her brothers, or even what they're like, except that they are both Wizards. 

She asks Besh if he could kill her father for leaving leaving her family to die.

She doesn't remember her face or her namme, but she remembers is that he's rich, that they lived in a big house near the center of Polaris, and that she's pretty sure she met him outside the Council's Keep on the night she was captured by Araki.
journals.name: Discussion with a Demon 2

journals.entry:
[organisation:403714] reached [location:6175] in the late morning and got straight to work. With the help of a [character:405807] we found [character:405205], the lord who used to have The Orange Stone (Perhaps he also used to have the yellow stone, but according to [character:300697] he doesn't have it anymore. I only trust this man for [character:288353] sake.), and he said he'd already sold it to [character:339905]. Turns out my father became a lord in the last 15 years. Luckily enough, he was also the past owner of [character:288997], so she knew who would want to help us with our heist for personal vengeance. After much convincing, [character:405811], a busines rival of Mark Evergreen's and another person who hates him, gave us costumes to use when we enter and advice on what to say.

And so we went to Mark's house, and right at the entrance, we met someone we know- [character:310275], a slave from Shoreman's group. Kota spent most of his time in the Evergreen mansion convincing the kid to help us and run with us. [character:288355] solved the loose end that was the wife: calmed her down so that she didn't even consider checking on us to see what we were doing. The three of them together stole Mark's gold and burned his files. No wonder they're the first friends I've made in years. Me, Araki and Nelli went with Mark to his office, and Araki made him busy with boat-talk (maybe I should've read more about boats, back at the temple) while I enchanted his finger to itch so that he'd take it off. I made an illusion of the ring being at a different place than where it actually were, and the moment he got out of the room, we stole The Orange Stone from Mark and took off immediately. Nelli even burned his house down, I'm starting to like her a lot.

We're outside Latormeio now. We have two Stones on Ellara, two children to take care of if we're not counting Kota (hehe. I'm gonna tell him that.) and six more stones to find.
journals.name: 07 - Feudal Family Feud

locations.entry:
The Purple City, also known as the city of Magic, Polaris is located on the northern shore of Skulaya, where the Kanito river pours into the ocean. Polaris is currently the largest of the six cities, with the largest population and the most active economy.

The Kanito river splits the city into two parts, Western Polaris and Eastern Polaris. The western part houses the city council, as well as the larger markets, all the temples and most of the higer class. The eastern part houses the main port and most of the population, with the richer being closer to the river and the poorer nearer to the city's border.

The city is ruled by a council consisting of 48 members, of which eight represent the Great Guilds (Brewers, Carpenters, Drivers, Grocers, Masons, Skinners, Smiths and Weavers), three represent the Purple Temple, and the others are elected by the general public.
locations.name: Polaris

locations.entry:
Used to be a prosperous village on the [location:5988] to enjoy its wealth yet just far enough to enjoy the pastoral surroundings. At its peak it housed around 1,200 residents. Eventually bandits and thieves noticed that the town was very rich yet hardly protected. Despite the towns' walls, it was to small to have a large garrison, and it was to far from Polaris for the city guard to reliably come to fend off offenders.

The town was abandoned around twnety years ago, and since then several rogue groups of bandits attempted to inhabit the ghost town, but they have repeatedly been removed by the Polaris city guard.
locations.name: Spearhill

notes.entry:
They plan to go to Alamania's house, before leaving the Dancing Dragon, Pasi says that he's not feeling well and would rather stay in the inn. He feels tired and a bit weak, and he looks slightly pale.

Two nights prior, Shoreman gave Tarninan a gift: necklace with bright red beads. He wanted to make sure the kid was didn't try to use his magic to escape during the ride to Lattormeio, and thus way the child would believe got sick from something in the forests. However, during Kota and Pasi's performance, he gave the necklace to Pasi.

 

Elara knows that Alamania lives somewhere on the Gold Road, near the God's Garden. They get to her house and Nelli opens the door. She's wearing a plain red nightgown that does not seem appropriate to the season. Last time they saw her she was wearing a bright red scarf, but now she isn't and on her bare neck they see two branded quarter-circles on her neck, one on the right and one on the left. 

She asks of they came to see her mother, inviting them in, saying she made a lot of food. Kota gets the feeling that he recognizes her from somewhere, but he has no idea from where.

 

Alamania shares how she isn't actually a goddess, her body is human but that since she was little the Black goddess came to her in her dreams, saying she had part of her soul in lieu of the Stone. She doesn't want others to know, but she knows they are loyal to her, and they haven't yet saved their last life.

If they ask how she knows she'll say that she knows them, she Elara's talents wasted away in her childhood, she saw Kota wearing another face - a false face, and she even saw Besh studying, that he will know things that no one knew before him and few will know after.

Nelli comes in holding an iron pot filled with delicious smelling cauliflower and mushroom soup in her bare hands. She sets it down on the table while warning the others that it's hot, whole winking at Elara. She then gives her a weird look asking her if they've met before, besides the other day after Alamania was shot.

If they ask about her, she will show them her brand and explain that she was a slave in Latormeio until Alamania bought her, freed her, then took her in as a daughter. She hopes for a day where children,  especially Wizard children, aren't sold or kidnapped into slavery.

 

The following morning Hendricson gives Elara a note saying "413, Cherry Street" and bearing two signatures: ER (Elyas Rinayo), and SC (Sor Carres).

The address leads them to a small inn, called the Green Gate inn. It's on the border of one of the poorest neighbourhoods in the city, Greenleaf Town. Sitting at a table outside, near the entrance, are two big brawny men, one of whom eyes them suspiciously as they enter. Inside they see four tables, with Elyas sitting besides on of them. Besides the table behind him sit five men, two of whom look like sellswords. On the table near the entrance are two other armed men.

Elyas invites them to his table, greeting Elara and Kota by name. He asks them what it is they wanted to discuss with him.

If asked about his political stance he will claim that contrary to popular belief, he doesn't hate Wizards, though he knows many who do. He does, however, despise how Alamania is ripping the city apart. He might mention that many people dislike the circus' coming, because many non-Wizards see it as an insult, while many pro-Wizards see it as unnecessary provocation.

If and about his past he will reveal that he was raised in a family of fishermen on the east bank. If asked about his sponsors he will mention that they all have placed to be: Kota should be rehearsing, Elara should be in another tavern, Besh should be in a book or something, and he himself is expecting a meeting with someone else.
notes.name: Session 03

notes.name: Name Backlog

notes.entry:
Pick up immediately where the last session ended. [character:6181] tells the PCs that she had a job for them. A while back she had a vision of a place where something is hidden, something very important that will help them in the coming struggle. She invites Besh to take the vision from her mind so that he could lead the others there.

He sees the ocean, above it soar basalt cliffs two hundred meters tall. Rapid winds buffet his face as he climbs the air up and over the top of the cliff. As he stares out over the ocean he notices a cave below him, overlooking the woods. To his right he cas see the black cliffs of [location:5988] in the distance, and to his left rise the Alanashu Mountains, vanishing into the clouds. He dives down to the entrance of the cave peering into the darkness, and he sees a faint glimmer within.

Alamania says that she will be leaving the city, taking hold of [location:316393], and calling the  other Wizards in the city to join her there. For the three of them it will be a three day trek to the cave and a four day return journey to Spearhill.

On the second night, a pack of wolves attacks during Kota's shift. He's feeling rather sleepy when he hears something scraping: a wolf is trying to take Ellara's pack. If he attempts to use magic to stop it, a larger wolf will pounce at him. In total there are three small wolves and one large wolf. If any two wolves are killed/knocked out, the others will flee.

 

After meeting with the mountain lions, as they cross the Gold road they meet two people walking on the road: a man named Gerensil, (40ish, wearing old traveling clothes and carrying a large pack) and a teen named Kanshanor (17, wearing a simple black tunic and with a far smaller pack). Geren introduces themselves as people from Applehill, and says that they were on the march for two days. He adds that Kanshi is a priest in the village's temple, and as a black Wizard (apprars to be 1), he wanted to see Alamania and study under her guidance. 

Kanshi asks them if they are also headed towards her, as the three Wizards seem an odd company to be alone on the Road. Geren asks if they would like to share the road with them, mentioning that he himself is a good hunter, and he saw some meaty-looking does by the side of the road.

At night, all three of them have dreams:

Kota is sitting in the Blue Temple with Araki, playing with the water in the fountain. They're talking about Kota's training and Araki's studies. They both have chores to do, but they don't care too much, they'll do them later. Kota splashes a big wave at Araki's arm, and Araki laughingly gives him a weak punch in the chest. It hurts. Kota's tied up, the cult is going on with the ritual. A bolt of lightning arcs from one of their hands and hits him in the chest. One of the people removes his cloak, revealing himself as Araki. He comes closer to Kota and whispers in his ear. The voice that comes out of his mouth isn't his, it's the one from his last dream, and it says "Kota, ignore it, it doesn't matter now. We need you. Wake up" And he wakes up.

Besh is in his hometown, sorting the inn's mail. He's still young, hoping against all odds to see a letter from his father. He finishes sorting them. There's a lot of letters: some for people staying at the inn, some of people making reservations, some for the innkeeper, and one for himself. He lazily opens it and skims the beginning: something about demons or whatever. Boring. He notices another envelope on the table, right in the middle. He has no idea how he missed it before, but there it was. It's a small envelope made of brown crumply paper, with no name or address written on it. It's unsealed. He peeks inside a d theres a small folded paper, with one thing written on it: "Wake up".

Elara is in her community. Her father said that she needs to read a book about something or other to help her get to terms with her magic, but she doesn't really want to, it's been weeks since she last set something on fire by accident, over a month since she caused real harm. Besides, she promised Hendricson she'll go to the market to buy new silverware for the inn. yet she must read. She pulls a book from the pile: "Demons: They're Here. Wake Up"

Elara is in her community, in the library. Her father said that she needs to read a book about something or other to help her get to terms with her magic, but she doesn't really want to, it's been weeks since she last set something on fire by accident, over a month since she caused real harm. Besides, she promised Hendricson she'll go to the market to buy new silverware for the inn. But father said sheust read, so she must read. She pulls a book from the pile: "Demons: They're Here. Wake Up".

They see Kanshi leaning over the pack of whoever has the Stone, and when he sees them wake up he surprised for a moment, then grabs the pack and tries to run.

If someone hits him with non-damaging magic, he conjures a soul blade and counters it (drama point if necessary). If he's hit with something that deals more than 15 points of damage, he vanishes.
notes.name: Session 04

notes.entry:
Sheech

The morning after they arrived at [location:316393], the gang wakes up. It's mid-morning, they leave their quarters in the town's temple ([character:6181] in the middle of the night to help him heal.

Alamania is indisposed at the moment, talking to someone important in her study. As they step out of the temple, they suddenly feel all the magic about them. Even Ellara can feel the magic in the air. There are so many Wizards, it feels so strange, they never saw that many Wizards in one place before. Even the non-Wizards in the town feel it.

Everyone is moving about, helping restore the town, fixing buildings, and setting up stores.

 

The night after they leave, Nelli gets a hunch (actually the Red Goddess telling her) that she should go with them. She tells her mother. Alamania suggests she send Ravani with her, but Nelli insists that she should go alone, so she rides after them.

A few nights ago, [character:300697] heard about Alamania's claim of being the Black Goddess. He pleaded the head of his temple  to let him go and meet her. He arrived in the Blue Temple of Polaris on the morning when the gang left Spearhill, and saw that the Colours of the World Circus was in town. He asked about Kota, and learned that he was helping an injured friend who was staying in the Black Temple. He went there the following morning, but found out that Kota wasn't there. He met Pasi, who was already healthy, to stay with him in the Blue Temple, since he heard that the city is not the safest place at the moment, but Pasi declined, saying that he'd wait for Besh and the others to return.

As Araki heads to the temple, he sees a little girl dressed in rags talking to some servants just outside the Council Quarters' gate. They're standing out in the snow and the servants are quivering from the cold despite their warm coats, but she looks just fine in her bare feet. At first he doesn't see any magic around her, but after a moment he sees a fine haze emanating from her hands and entering their heads. He realizes that she's a demon, and quickly runs to the nearby Purple Temple. He calls for help, and then three Purple priests and he go to stop the demon. She resists and kills two of the priests: she makes one of them run through another with his sword, and she sets the third on fire. Araki and the remaining priest managed to knock her out and took her to the Temple, where they tied her arms and legs and threw her in the dungeon. 

When she woke up a few hours later she cried and begged that the guards let her talk to Araki, refering to him as "the unseen blue". He was waiting in the temple, hoping to study her when she awoke, so he came down, and after begging to be released she offered him a deal: she won't resist or try to escape, and in return he'll let her talk with "the golden key, and its blue and red companions" when they return to the city. He accepteda went to the Black temple, where he left a letter with Pasi.

Unbeknownst to him, the girl (named Toumeri) have the servants
notes.name: Session 05

notes.name: Gods

notes.entry:
The same night that the gang arrives in [location:316393], Ellara has a dream. Ask Ronit where Ellara sees herself: somewhere relaxing, where she feels comfortable. She feels calm, at peace, in a way she didn't feel in a long time. A character walks up to her, a teen in a green dress. She introduces herself as the Green Goddess, and tells Ellara that if she wants, she could try to make her into her unofficial desciple. She doesn't want to officially turn her into a desciple, since that would require "awakening", which would be very dangerous with the new revelation that there are demons about. Additionally, she isn't sure what linking Ellara to the Green Stone would actually do to her, since the only precedent for a Wizard being bound to a differently coloured Stone is of a Yellow Wizard with the Purple Stone, and both the Wizard and the Stone are very special exceptions. 

If Ellara agrees, the Goddess tells her that she'll tell [character:6181] to return the Stone to her, and if Alamania refuses, she'll try to force her subtly.

If Ellara refuses, the Goddess asks her to reconsider, saying that while she thinks Alamania is on the right side, she thinks the Black Goddess is planning something, and she doesn't want to trust her as long as she doesn't know what she's up to. If Ellara still refuses, the Goddess accepts it gracefully and returns Ellara to her dream.
notes.name: Session 04.5

notes.entry:
Suite from "Restless" (Buffy) - Spotify
Kota revelation.

Araki's walking through the snow in Umigate, trying to hide. Goes to a building with the city's crest on it's door. Knocks, but gets no answer. After knocking again he tries to open the door, revealing an office with five dead men, with stab wounds and foam in their mouths.

He hides inside until a young man with black hair and the clothes of a Yellow Priest comes in.

Araki goes down a staircase with 6 armed guards. They open a door and a fight ensues. He sees something small glowing Yellow on the floor. There's a bright Yellow flash.

People are dying, there's blood everywhere. Araki uses his magic to hide in the corner of the room, trying to reach Kota who's lying on the floor, but it's so hectic. Arrows and swords and lightning and blood are all moving so fast. It all happened so fast.

After the fighting, Kota is lying on the floor. Araki is on his knees and sees that Kota isn't breathing. He tries to use his magic to no avail. He takes something out of his pocket.

Earlier that evening Araki was talking to a Black Priest, and the Priest gives him something.

Araki begs the Black Stone to tell him what to do. He takes a knife from one of the bodies and cuts open Kota's chest, then inserts the Stone between his ribs. He steps back. After a few seconds Kota begins to glow with a bright Black Light, and the cut on his chest closes, leaving a feint scar, blending with the many marks that the lightning left behind. When he wakes up, Araki asks him who he is.

The two are walking in the streets of Umigate, distant lights of a Mid-Winter Festival are glowing over the rooftops. Araki's hiding them with his magic, while Kota walks beside him.

https://open.spotify.com/track/1uFfUnP0v76OKh6MeLJyoK

notes.entry:
קוטה

אני מצטער שלא הרחבתי במידע במכתבי הקודם, אבל לא רציתי לשאת בסיכון שמישהו אחר יקרא אותו לפניך. הגעתי לפולאריס ואני חושב שטעיתי: לא מדובר בפעילות של הכת בעיר זו, אלא נראה שיש שדים שפועלים עצמאית.

אני מחכה לך במקדש הכחול, ותביא איתך את עמיתיך, האדומה והכחול.

א'.
notes.name: Araki's Letter to Kota

notes.entry:
As [character:288347] falls asleep he sees his mother in the same white void where he saw [character:319362] the other night.

She greets him, and while it's in her voice, he can feel that it isn't her. She tells him that he and his friends have already killed two of her envoys.

She changes to Jacob. He's not mad, saying that while it's not ideal, it's a price that he's willing to pay.

He changes to Ellara. She knows Besh will do the right thing in the end, even if he doesn't want to.

She changes to Kanshi. He offers him a gift. He asks him if he would like to learn how he cut through his illusion magic.

He changes to Alamania. She says that she doesn't trust the mission falling into the hands of the gods, since while she believes they truly want the best for humanity, what she's bringing might be too much for them.

She changes to Araki. He knows that Besh will understand what he must do when the time is right, because he knows what really matters.

He tells him that [character:362745] (the demon they killed) wants to speak with him. 

He changes into her. She looks pretty much the same as when he last saw her, dressed in rags, barefoot and with dirty and mangled hair. She appears confused and distressed, doesn't understand where she is or what happened. She pulls away from Besh when she sees him. She asks what he did to her.

She asks from him to get revenge on her father for abandoning her, and tells him that she probably wasn't the first. She had two brothers and a mother who she never met. She doesn't know much about them, but she does know that her mother came from far away and feared her own magic. She was a Purple Wizard, and became enchanted by her father's magic. Her older brother is much older than her, and he was born like her mother, so her father hid him away when he was born. Her twin brother was also born like her mother, while she herself was more similar to her father. He left her mother and twin brother with nothing, while he took her in with him.

She's pretty sure her mother died a couple of years ago, but has no idea what happened to her brothers, or even what they're like, except that they are both Wizards. 

She asks Besh if he could kill her father for leaving leaving her family to die.

She doesn't remember her face or her namme, but she remembers is that he's rich, that they lived in a big house near the center of Polaris, and that she's pretty sure she met him outside the Council's Keep on the night she was captured by Araki.
notes.name: Discussion with a Demon 2

notes.entry:
A week prior to Alamania going to [location:316393], the council decided (in a motion headed by [character:362758]) that they should clear the bandits who holed up in there. There was a small battle, but the bandits fled.

They are led by siblings Heslin (a short, charismatic man) and Gremia (a tall woman, who is a powerful Orange Wizard). The other members include Seliaris (Heslin and Germia's childhood friend and a Blue Wizard, shy but very unasertive), Tolre (a fugitive from a nearby town, who is very intelligent but untrusting of strangers, good with knives), and Lugien (ex-guard from a town near Haeven, left after seeing the corruption in her town, and is a very good archer and huntress). They lost several friends when the guards attacked (Lorelei, Esmon, Rele, Fugi)

If they stay in the city, Joleniel has gotten the
notes.name: Session 06

notes.entry:
16 years ago Mark Evergreen (back then known as Mark Orban) was on his way from [location:6175] to [location:5988], delivering cargo for Lord Mikkel. When given the job, Mikkel gave him a ring embedded with a bright orange gemstone, and a large yellow stone to be delivered in person. When he got to the [location:403752] he met [character:403753] and showed her the Stones, but she believed they were fake. 

On the way back, while passing under the [location:289005] his ship was attacked by pirates. When they busted into his chamber and tried to kill him, their blades bounced off his skin, allowing him to singlehandedly kill or disable most of those attacking him, while the others fled. 

When he stopped in [location:405183] he told [character:405184] about the Stones, saying that they could make a fortune for themselves and their son, but she insisted that they stay in Summer Pass with her family, not wanting to frighten her son with major changes.

Upon returning to Lord Mikkal he told him that Corvina decided the stones were fake, but then he asked to buy the stones himself, to which Mikkal accepted.

Mark started saving money and slowly bought more and more ships. He owns a fleet of over 100 boats and ships all over the world. He also started getting into the mining business, buying slaves and getting them to work in the crystal caverns. 5 years ago a slave in his mine found the Red Stone, and he later gave it to [character:6181] (along with [character:288997]) in exchange for a position of power when she retakes Polaris.

3 years ago he made a deal with [character:291114], giving him the yellow stone, in exchange for the priest researching how it could be used to form a permanent gate that could be used (and monetized) for trading. However, the Stone vanished during a raid on the temple, and Evergreen is very salty about that.

He got married three times: to a lady from Umigate called Emika who gave him 2 sons and a daughter, to a lady from [location:6178] named Fleur, who gave him 2 daughters, and is currently married to Lisa, who is eight months pregnant pregnancy.
notes.name: Session 07
